results.title: As India’s Lethal Covid Wave Neared, Politics Overrode Science
results.abstract: The country’s top science agency tailored its findings to fit Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s optimistic narrative despite a looming crisis, researchers say.

results.title: With Schools Closed, Covid-19 Deepens a Philippine Education Crisis

results.title: A Million Afghan Children Could Die in ‘Most Perilous Hour,’ U.N. Warns
results.abstract: The international community pledged more than $1 billion in emergency aid as millions of Afghans risk running out of food just as winter sets in.
results.byline: By Marc Santora, Nick Cumming-Bruce and Christina Goldbaum

multimedia.caption: Women begging for alms outside a bakery in Kabul, Afghanistan, on Monday. One in three Afghans do not know where they will get their next meal.

results.abstract: The army has escalated attacks on militias that oppose its rule, driving thousands of people into the hills. A shadow government has called for a nationwide uprising.

results.title: Seeking Art That Expands the Possibilities for a Troubled World

results.title: In an Ancient Greek Port, a New Cultural Hub
results.abstract: The city of Piraeus, just outside Athens, is becoming a haven for galleries and design studios attracted by its abundant warehouses and growing creative community.

results.title: In a new review, some F.D.A. scientists and others say boosters aren’t needed for the general population.
results.abstract: The benefits of a third shot for most people are small and are far outweighed by the benefits of using those doses for initial vaccinations, the scientists say.

results.title: Lone Survivor of Italian Cable Car Crash Is Subject of Custody Battle
results.abstract: The grandfather of a 6-year-old boy who survived an accident that killed his parents in May is under investigation after taking him to Israel.

multimedia.caption: After five members of an Israeli family were killed in a cable car accident in northern Italy in May, their bodies were taken to Milan.

results.title: Researchers will study whether the vaccines affect women’s periods.
results.abstract: Some vaccinated women and girls have reported changes in their menstrual cycles, although no formal studies have yet examined the issue.

results.title: The J.&J. Conundrum
results.abstract: A guide to whether Johnson & Johnson vaccine recipients should get a booster shot — and how they might do so.

results.title: A Stunning Look at the Hidden Mysteries of Glacier Caves
results.abstract: A group of scientists and adventure athletes are venturing into icy labyrinths to study their relationships with glacial melting and climate change.

multimedia.caption: During the summer, moulins are filled with raging waterfalls. Fall’s cooler temperatures shut off surface melting and allow a brief window for glacier cave exploration before moulins become plugged with winter’s drifting snow. Here, Will Gadd finishes climbing out of a moulin during the Red Bull Beneath the Ice expedition to explore and study Greenland’s glacier caves.
multimedia.copyright: Jason Gulley
